page.title: 15PENPONDS FARM cont'd
page.content: ...The clamp silage is stored freshly cut in a pile, whereas the roundbate silage is cut, wilted on land for 24 hrs., then baled in \ton bundles for storage in airtight black polythene bags. About 400 bales of straw are bought from nearby farms for cattle bedding on the farm. The milk produced by the cows is taken via M.M.B. bulktankers to Camborne for butter-making, or to a Cornish creamery. The steepness of the land around Penponds makes tractor work dangerous on several acres, and although it is near impossible to work on 4 acres of the land, Pendponds Farm manages to produce a good turnover on average, every year. _____
